description: WHAT MAKES US A GREAT PLACE TO WORKWe are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world’s best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently #1 ranked consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list and have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor’s list for the last 13 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents. WHO YOU’LL WORK WITHA talent and human resources job at Bain can prepare you for anything that follows in your career. Here, people are our single greatest asset and the entire company’s success hinges on your capacity to find, develop, and guide those talented people. That means we'll entrust you with the resources you need to craft an inclusive and sustainable team, and to contribute to the culture we know leads to great work.WHERE YOU’LL FIT WITHIN THE TEAM The HRBP, Global Human Resources will serve as HR generalist for various departments within the Capability Delivery Solutions and Private Equity functions. The successful candidate will be responsible for employee relations, talent strategy, performance management, compensation, operational support, and more. They will help to develop and drive consistent, effective HR policies and talent management programs, collaborating closely with the business lines on professional development, learning/training and employee engagement. WHAT YOU’LL DO 80%   Serve as the HR Business Partner for allocated departments within Capability Delivery Solutions and Private Equity functions:Be on point for the customer group employee lifecycle, including employee relations, performance management, compensation, policy interpretation, risk management, professional development and employee services.Liaise regularly with leadership team, employees, and leadership teams. Develop strong and productive working relationships/high levels of communication with key stakeholders; become known as the “go to” person for all HR needs for the functions.Provide thought partnership to leadership on talent issues impacting customer group, e.g. employee engagement, organization and role design, etc.Exercise discretion and business judgment to manage all employee relations issues, including performance concerns, team conflicts, grievances, investigations, accommodations, and other matters.With guidance from Global HR Program team and support from Specialist, lead efficient and effective performance review and compensation review processes.Train and develop program management team on best practices for risk management, performance management, and facilitating difficult conversations.Work with the employee relations and in-house legal teams to educate/advise management as necessary; playa leadership role in investigations and resulting decision-making.Collaborate with the Business and Experienced Talent Recruiting to support hiring needs and effective on-boarding and integration processes.Collaborate with global compensation team on compensation needs for the function, including educating line managers and employees on Bain’s compensation philosophy and relevant compensation structures.Be a champion and thought partner to drive DEI initiatives within CDS and Private Equity.Manage, coach and develop direct report.10%   Actively contribute to the broader Global HR team:Liaise regularly with other HR Business Partners/HR generalists within the Global Talent Management team to ensure consistency and sharing of best practicesParticipate in project teams by supporting roll-out and repeatability efforts, population analysis, and cross-office/functional coordination.10%    Other duties assigned as position or circumstances dictateABOUT YOUEducationRequiredBachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of
